definition: old fox/slick customer

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
oil/fat/grease/petroleum/to apply tung oil, paint or varnish/oily/greasy/glib/cunning
strip/item/article/clause (of law or treaty)/classifier for long thin things (ribbon, river, road, trousers etc)

sentences.english: This guy's a wily old bird. Don't believe what he says.
sentences.chinese: 这人是个老油条了，你别太相信他。

sentences.english: This spin did not convince old pros on Wall Street.
sentences.chinese: 这个说法并不能说服华尔街的老油条。

sentences.english: That guy is a slippery customer.
Not even a week in here and you're already working it like an old con.
sentences.chinese: 来这儿还不到一周，你做起事儿来就像是个老油条。

definition: (coll.) wily old fox/crafty fellow
a much-travelled person, well acquainted with the ways of the world
sophisticate/man with extensive experience/child prodigy/Wunderkind (i.e. brilliant child)/spirit within a person (i.e. blood and essential breath 血氣|血气 of TCM)
cunning/crafty/wily old fox
experienced person/an old hand at sth
veteran
rigorous schemes and deep foresight (idiom); astute and circumspect
mixed in as part of a community/hiding one's identity/occupying a position while not deserving it
old hand/veteran
lit. veteran of a hundred battles (idiom)/fig. experienced/seasoned
variant of 老奸巨猾[lao3 jian1 ju4 hua2]
annoying person/troublemaker/pain in the neck
to muddle things up/to goof off/to hang around
oily/greasy/unctuous/slippery (character)
officialdom/bureaucracy
experienced in the ways of the world (idiom); worldly-wise/sophisticated
